caption: Veggie pizza was great and the staff was professional and knowledgeable about menu

Do yourself a favor and order from somewhere else.  I placed a $100+ order last night for St. Patrick's Day. The order was originally supposed to be delivered at 7:16PM. Around 7:28PM, I called the restaurant and was told the order would be delivered in 5-10 minutes. Around 7:45PM, I called back and was told the order would not be coming and I would receive a full refund. I was upset, but moved on and decided to make dinner instead. 2 hours and 30 minutes after I placed the order and 45 minutes after being told my food wouldn't arrive, some random person dropped off the order on my porch. Even though the night staff assured me I would be getting a refund since my food wasn't coming, the manager stated I was no longer eligible because the food eventually arrived (after I had made and eaten dinner). He offered a 50% refund. A 50% refund on an order that I was told was cancelled. A 50% refund for cold, stale food after I already went through the trouble of making dinner. I did not want the food and offered to return it to the restaurant, but the manager would not accept it. They can have the cold, disgusting looking food back. I want my money.
Bad attitude for serving my food and prepared.
The calazones are delicious.
Great pizza - especially the crust!!

Was not a fan of the pizza. Got a 16” pizza that was supposed to be NY style. I’ve been to NY and my husband from around there. That wasn’t it. Not bad pizza, just definitely not NY style. LA PIZZA on delmar is authentic NY style
The right mix of crispy and chewy Brooklyn style pizza. Toppings were great. Couldn't get enough!
I really like their pizza. You judge a place base on a plain on cheese pie, and Racanelli's is delicious. I got the cheese pie with extra cheese, and I'll definitely order again.

This is the last time I am ordering from this place. This is the second time that my entire order was completely cold. Every other local pizza place I order from doesn't have this problem regardless of weather.

I just tried the New York Style pizza and it didn't have hardly any flavor. Simply bland. Pizza is  my favorite and i couldn't even finish a slice after reheating it since it was cold upon delivery. This was my first experience and unfortunately my last. Especially considering it is only a couple blocks from my place.

So my pizza was 30 minutes late even though I had to wait an hour and it was cold and then they charged me $10 for the delivery fee and didn't even get it to the delivery driver. So if you want cold pizza at $50 and to wait an hour and a half to get it when you're right down the street this is the right place for you. They really need to consider negative star ratings
We had ours delivered. Fast service, excellent pizza!!

I gave them three Star on the memory of how good they pizza were the first two times I ordered from them the meat lovers good nice price but to salty for me last night I ordered mediterranean veggie worse mistake of my life I was really upset with my self I paid$30 for a cheese pizza they forgotten about my veggie it like they said f  my  green pepper onion and   burnt  the crust I would of called and complain but for what if you're are not happy at your job find another one and let the people who like that job shine so I'm going to wait a couple of months hopefully it will be people there who cares about their job don't mind supporting people we all got to make a living please don't make people food like that ever again best of luck

Ordered pizza at 5:30. It was supposed to be delivered at 6:38 and it never came. Manager said post mates is to blame and they have been having issues. Clearly postmates is to blame, but until they can get a trustworthy delivery system, I definitely would not use for delivery. Covid is going to kill local companies without delivery services.  Manager did refund our money instantly which was nice of them.
Best New York style pizza in St Louis area
Great hot slice from friendly staff!

My wife called twice and they kept putting her on hold and never came back. Once was over 5 minutes and the other was just at 5 minutes. I know it doesnt seem long but when you get put on hold to order food it shouldnt be very long. I then called myself and they asked if I could hold I said no that my wife was put on hold already. He said ok one sec he put the phone down and then 2 seconds later put me on hold. Very unprofessional attitude.

I hate to leave 1 star  but the "hot" chicken wings I just received were terrible. Pros: The ranch was decent. Cons: The actual quality of the chicken was awful, like it was very old and not fresh at all. It tasted like they were originally heated at some point in the past and then reheated. They were so dry. Finally, I ordered "hot" wings and it definitely says that on my receipt but there didn't appear to really be any sauce on the wing. Now I understand that there are varying degrees of sauciness but this bordered on me not even being able to tell if they ever sauced this wing. No spice, no flavor, no heat at all. Extremely disappointing bone-in wings.
A favorite place for delicious Pizza. Service is always timely even when they have a full house. Service is typically above par. This place has a nice feel to it.

I have picked up for door dash here several times. Only one time was the order ready. This last time I get there at the time I was suppose to pick the order up it’s not even started. The staff were not paying attention to the tablet. So now I have to wait 20 mins which messes up my stats. I would never suggest to order from here.

Ordered a pie to go, they quoted me an hour.  Once I arrived they told me another 45 minutes. They could have called and said they were running late and never did. They did not care nor made any attempt to provide  any type of customer service. I prepaid with a 20% tip and they would not refund me. If I could, I would give them zero stars... never going there again.
Was great haven't had it years but still good!!

My first visit to Racanellis CWE...I got a cheeseburger pizza and it was extra salty..The pizza had no flavor or maybe the over powering taste of salt masked the flavor..Pick up went smoothly but I won’t be back..I’ve had better pizza at Pizza Hut.
Food was very good. This is one of our favorite pizza places in St. Louis.
Bad service. Cold pizza. Never open.
Yummy thin crust NY style, fast service, good prices (got 2 slices). Very safety conscious too!
The person who brought our pizza to the curbside on 7/23/20 did not wear a mask and when my husband asked him to put it on, he was rude and refused.

Thur7/9/20 530pm😊 Ordered 2 med pizzas; the vegetables I ordered were very, very, few, & the pizzas were salty😖!!! (I guess the taste could  depend on who’s chef that day😧... Anyway, for the price of $43, I’ve had pizza from Sam’s Club for under half ↗️this price, & it taste excellent😘!!! No membership required to order from Sam’s Club take out😇.
I currently work here and its an Amazing place to work. Plus the pizza is always good.
If you’re looking for a good NY style pizza, this is the place you’ll find it!
Yum! East Coast Pizza.
I love this place!! Make me think of home back east.
I’m from NJ. This is the best pizza in St. Louis, feels like I’m back at home.
Just wasn't impressed..crust was still kinda doughy..prices ridiculous
Best pizza in St. Louis
This is by far the best slice of NY style pizza I've ever had. Not as big as typical NY style pies, but definitely amazing!
Best pizza in the Lou

The size of the pizza by the slice was absolutely gigantic! The price was under $4 for it too and they were very generous with the toppings. The inside was very spacious and cozy too. Well lit. Quick service too. I am looking forward to going back and trying more.

i get that they were short staffed today (12/26/19) we waited about 30 minutes for 4 pieces of individual slices. the cashier told us that the pizza had artichoke on it when it had eggplant. they worked without gloves which was disgusting. pizza was more oily than oil itself. pizza was bland and generic, store didn’t seem sanatized. no hair nets too. very very slow, people next to me waited like 45 minutes. no satasfied.
Best authentic New York style pizza and calzone you can find anywhere around St Louis... period.

Pizza tastes worse with every visit. The pizza used to be good and that probably holds true for the Delmar location, but this one is trash. Somehow, the female cashier thought I asked for extra pepperoni and when my slice came out, you could tell the cook put extra cheese on top of a slice that had already been cooked. The presentation was atrocious. I was able to get a new slice that looked much better, but was underwhelming to the taste. The only plus was the nice young man who took my salad plate out the way, upon bringing my new slice. Save your money and get better quality pizza in CWE by going to ‘ZZA or Pi.
I’ve never been there before but their food does look good in the pictures on their website.
Just a great pizza and awesome service

My uncle who is a throat cancer survivor ordered 2 pizzas with extra sauce because the  extra sauce makes it easier to swallow was told it would be a 30 minute wait waited an hour got there still had to wait 30 more minutes and the pizza was burnt and had no extra sauce took the pizza back and was told I am not getting my money back and they laughed in my uncle's face please do not go here
If i could give zero stars i would
Waited 50 minutes to get my pizza. Do not come here for lunch.

I literally love this pizza! The restaurant is clean, the prices are perfect for a quick lunch, and usually the staff is super helpful and friendly; it's great seeing familiar faces. Today (10/18, 2:30p CST) was the first time I've ever gotten dry/curt service from an employee. She acted as if having to take an order was an inconvenience, rolled her eyes when I asked question about pizza size and walked off mid-order on multiple people in line. The vibe in here is usually casual and amicable, & she definitely isn't a good fit.  Edit: Central West End
Great pizza and calzones. Reasonably priced with a friendly staff.

The pizza's fine I guess, but it’s only a shell compared to pizza in New York. They don’t have any pies out on display, they won’t serve you slices if it’s within an hour or so of closing (perhaps work on your business if demand is so low that you won’t make a new pie), and at this location, the restaurant always smells like someone diarrheaed in the bathroom and the AC is blowing it everywhere. I’ve brought it up multiple times, but they tell me it doesn’t smell. I apologize for not spending enough time in there to get acclimated, Racasmellis.  I suggest you guys take a trip to New York to study what makes their pizza the best in the world and try to emulate it.

I order 14 inch pizza it was over cook a burned you could taste that the pizza was burnt. An I order some boneless hot wings an they where just some frozen wings that was just warmed up horrible experience will not recommend to anyone.
Nice staff, friendly people. Best pizza I've ever had!!
Ordered two slices. Big slices and very thin crust. Friendly staff and comfortable environment. I’ll be back.
Rude cashier but food was awesome
$2.75 for a cheese slice + .50 topping The size is very generous. Crust is thin and crispy. Service is fast. Overall worth the price.
By far my favorite pizza place. We live outside the city and drive in specifically for this place. Always reminds me of my pizza place in my home town growing up.
They always seem to be short staffed so you might have to wait a minute but the pizza is good.
I had the best pizza of my life .... Crust was perfect.... Everyone was friendly.  We are now making this our go to pizza stop every time we visit St. Louis from Quincy, Il.
My Favorite New York Style Pizza Place in St Louis
Yummy pizza and staff always is nice!
Don't bother - dirty, slow service. Go up the street to Zza, or if you want NY style go to Pie Guy in the Grove or Pizza Head on S. Grand.
Food is great! But to the girl wearing the glasses working the front im sorry i wanted food and that was inconvenient for you.

Terrible customer service!! Our office tried to place an order today for 6 of us, and we were trying to figure out how much we would owe individually and asked for their tax rate. The woman on the phone went to find out what is was, but didn't cover the phone when she said "this lady is being difficult, I don't like people like this". Well, we cancelled our order, which was over $60, and don't plan to order from this restaurant again. too many places to get lunch in this area without putting up with rudeness on the phone. And get this - she said she was a manager!
Truely NEW YORK Pizza!!😋😀
Called for information wa shung up on very rudely. I normally go to two other locations for the last 15 years so this was horrible treatment
Excellent pizza, made exactly as it should be.

THIS PLACE IS HORRIBLE.. I WENT ONCE AND HAD A HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE THE MANAGER DID NOT SEEM TO CARE.. TODAY I DECIDED TO GIVE IT ANOTHER TRY.. I WORK AT BJC ACROSS THE STREET I WENT TO PICK A CPL OF CO WORKERS AND MY FOOD UP TODAY...ONCE AGAIN HORRIBLE.. I WAS TOLD NO RED PEPPER I CLD NOT BE GIVEN MY SODA CUPS BEFORE I GOT MY FOOD. WHEN ASKED IF THEY HAVE A DRINK CARRIER I WAS TOLD KNOW.. WHEN ASKED IF THEY HAD A PLASTIC BAG I CLD HAVE SINCE I HAD I HAD MULTIPLE ORDERS.. I WAS TOLD THEY DID NOT HAVE ANY..EVEN THOUGH MY SALAD WAS GIVEN TO ME IN A PLASTIC BAG..
Place is good but the one is the loop tastes better
As far as the food goes, it's the best part of the place. Great style of pizza that you can't find around here most of the time. Don't expect world-class service though
This location has terrible customer  service. The food is good but expect a wait to get your food and an even longer wait if they mess anything up.
NY style pizza in St Louis.

Had the girl behind the counter had a little more enthusiasm and not had smelled like marijuana, we would have made a larger purchase. Pay attention to how you present yourself. Your presentation does matter to your customers.

Weve travel all over the world and this pizza is our favorite. Service can be a little bit friendlier but the pizza is great. People on the counter are always busy answering the phone, helping customers and being waiting tables which takes a bit off from the experience. But if you want good pizza there you have it.
Mr. Dan is AWESOME

This was my first and last visit here.  If you  advertise a picture of boneless wings, hot probably should have the boneless wings that look like the ones in the picture.  Nothing special about this place.  Nothing special at all.  I can't recommend this place for anything,  just keep walking past the window and go somewhere else. I can not make this up if I tried.

THERE ISN'T AN OPTION FOR NEGATIVES.  IF YOU'RE MILITARY OR A VETERAN - READ THIS REVIEW FIRST!!! Beyond  frustrated with the Manager (Dan), who was literally loud enough with his negative comments towards false impressions of the Military force.  All his comments was heard in the lobby with other patrons waiting on their pizza.  I, myself was the one who apparently sparked his tantrum when I inquired about a military discount, which could've been resolved with a simple comment, "sorry, we dont offer military discount".  Sounds simple right? Nope, not enough for this man who wanted to express his opinion loud for me to hear in front lobby.  Let me put this into perspective....the Manager, was in the back preparing my pizza...at this point who knows what was done to my pizza!!!!!  Paid for 2 pizzas, but not eating any from this guy was talking negatively and preparing my pizza at the same time!  Simply put, this anti-military, disgruntled, and unprofessional MANAGER, does not need to be a manager of any establishment.  When I advised the cashier to inform Dan, he had not a clue on what he was talking about and if he wanted a free lesson on the military, I would be happy to educate him so.  His employees were embrassed and non-stop were apologetic about the incident.  "99% of US never saw combat", "we get paid handsomely", "we get a 40K bonus after 4 years"....REALLY????  WHAT MILITARY IS THIS GUY REFERING TO.  NEVER WILL GO TO THIS PLACE OR REFER ANYONE HERE.
Love it
I'm used to NY style pizza, and this is my go to spot for pizza. STL can keep that imos stuff to themselves.
Worst pizza i ever had! Greasy and over priced.Girl behind the counter with bad attitude did not help the matter. Don't waste your time or your money!
Fast delivery. Great food. Friendly staff.
Great pizza, friendly service!
A pizza that we were told would take an hour and 15 min took two hours. And the pizza was mediocre. Their solution? A 50 cent can of soda. Not worth the aggravation.
My wife who is from New York says its the closest thing to home. Really good pizza!

DELICIOUS PIZZA AND ONE OF MY FAVORITE RESTAURANTS IN MY NEIGHBORHOOD. I JUST ORDERED A CHEF SALAD AND IM DISAPPOINTED THE LETTUCE ISN'T CHOPPED INTO SMALL PIECES INSTEAD THE PIECES ARE HUGE. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND CHOPPING YOUR LETTUCE INTO SMALL PIECES.
Great food and prices. Terrible listeners
Very good pizza! Order at counter!

POOR delivery , completely wrong order, still waiting for the correct order after a half hour. Had to prompt apology from the management who was not even sure that the right order was being delivered. Not even sure of what to think about such poor accountability and lack of sincerity,
Pizza is good. We only waited for about 10 minutes. Offered a Togo box and drink. Very nice.
Great tasting pizza and nice atmosphere
Nice place.  Good food for the price..
This is by far the best slice of NY style pizza I've ever had. Not as big as typical NY style pies, but definitely amazing!
Always a nice place to stop fot a slice

Slow service - took them 26 minutes to get me the last slice of cheese in my 3-item order. The food that did arrive was unimpressive. The pizza was thin and and so over cooked it was hard to chew through the crust. $14.65 for two slices and wings, which is fine, but not great.
Good pizza
Great authentic Italian NYStyle pizza on the cheap! Perfect crispy-chewy crust, delicious sauce, and ooey-gooey cheese. Get it by the slice or whole pie! Great calzones and sandwiches too
This was an okay experience. Food was mediocre and greasy. But the price is good and didn’t take too long. I doubt I’d come back here
Good New York style pizza. Not cheap though.
Food was OK.
Nice outdoor seating w great view of Central West End
Great pizza

Yesterday, while enjoying a beer at Itap next to Racanelli's, we decided to order a pizza online and pick it up when we were finished. We ordered the Sicilian at 4:08pm (I can forward you the e-mail conf.,), gave it an hour as stated on the menu. I (Amber) went in to pick up the pizza after an hour had passed. I gave the girl at the counter my name and she proceeded to print out a ton of things from the receipt printer. My receipt was then e-mailed to me at that time. After all the things printed out she told me it would be a few minutes for the pizza.  Meanwhile, as she is telling me this, another FEMALE employee is exiting the MENS restroom, with a man clearly still in the restroom.(he never exited in the time I was there) I have a pretty clear view of this from the counter. (might want to check your cameras if you have them). Pretty gross given there isn't really an excuse for a female employee to be in the mens restroom with a man when there are male employees working.  So, as I continue to wait a few minutes for my pizza, the male employee comes from the back and asks me if I am waiting for the Sicilian. I say yes, and he then informs me it will be a while. I ask how long and he tells me 25 minutes. Seriously? I have already waited an hour and was just told it would be a few minutes. I walk out to let my boyfriend know we should probably just order more beer because it is going to be another 25 minutes. Doesn't really make sense to have to wait 90 minutes for a pizza.  My boyfriend (Josh) then goes inside and asks about the wait and he was told the same thing. He told them he didn't want the pizza. The female employee who was in the mens restroom walked into the back laughing. A male employee then came out and told him the pizza was in the oven. Josh told him he didn't want it, and the employee just kept repeating that the pizza was already in the oven. He told them he placed the order at 4:08pm and was told that they go by "their time" Josh's response was that he goes by actual time. Josh then had to argue to get his money back, and was asked why he couldn't just wait for the pizza. Are you kidding me? After finally getting his money back he was told for future reference the Sicilian takes an hour. HELLO GENIUSES... IT HAD BEEN AN HOUR! Perhaps if someone hadn't been in the mens room and doing their job, the pizza would have been on time? Just a thought.
NY style pizza by the slice.
Best pizza around Barnes Jewish Hospital
Great lunch specials and good pizza.
Pizza was OK
Great food!

80 minute delivery, which was fine--it says on the website the Sicilian takes a bit longer to cook. However, the pizza ended up being pretty badly undercooked. A doughy center is never a good look on a deep dish style pizza. I'd probably try it again, because the flavor was okay, but I doubt I'll do another $25 Sicilian.
Great New York style pizza

I'm giving one star to this location only. I ordered 3 slices ofor pizza to go and when I received my order it was wrong. I told the cashier and before I could finish explaining what was missing from the pizza she took the box without hearing what I had to say. The manager was rude and when I asked her to refund the money she stated that it was against store policy. They never returned with the food that I payed for and didn't even offer to make it over. I will not recommend this location to anyone. You cannot mess up someone's order and then take the food away and not give them a refund. I should've called the cops
The manger was very inconsiderate of my order and didn't even attempt a resolution to the bad service. Rest of staff were respectful. Pizza was cold and mediocre.
Best New York style pizza ever!
Racanelli's is good pizza, not terribly great, but pretty good. Especially for the price of a single slice. The sauce has great flavor, but the cheese leaves much to be desired.
The best pizza in STL..
Usually great but I've a couple of times where it hasn't been up to par.
Delicious Brooklyn style pizza. Quaint. Busy during weekdays at lunchtime.
I really like the pizza, but it is rather expensive compared to delivery chains.
Excellent Pizza, try the Sicilian for a thick crust experience, and you won't be disappointed
Tasty pizza, but ordering by the slice regularly takes ~20 minutes.
Great pizza and specials.

I've been missing some quick and greasy pizza slices. I just decided to walk in during a bike ride for a quick bite to eat and the food was perfect. Cheap, plentiful, and tasty. If you want some NY style pizza with no frills or expense that is common in CWE, then head here. Staff are friendly and service was fast to boot.

Great New York pizza, which is a blessing in the land of provel/sauce paste that is STL style pizza. Tastes pretty much like you're in the big apple. Basically the only place I order pizza from in this city.

Quality has gone way down over the last year.  Orders not correct, didn't bring food out even after it was cooked (1 hour wait for two slices of pizza - no joke), charging for items that were not received, two trips just to get properly refunded, light on toppings, etc.  The manager made it right (eventually), and I was willing to give it another chance (two more, actually), but they continued to disappoint.  The pattern is too consistent.  Used to be my favorite pizza joint in central west end, but now I have to go elsewhere.
Great NYC Style Pizza.  Made by order, by the slice, any toppings you like.  Always comes out fresh!
This is probably my favorite pizza place in the CWE. My wife and I always order by the slice any get side salads. The food comes out quickly and the staff is friendly.
Awesome New York style slices of ambrosia. Truly fit for kings and queens. They will bring you a slice or a whole pie while you enjoy a brew at the tap house next door!
Excellent New York style pizza Love the Bronx Bomber
Decent pizza
Great NY style pizza!
It was great better than that nasty Chicago deep dish crap
We
born and raised in Brooklyn, NY looking for actual good pizza in St. Louis. Found it!
The Sicilian style pizza is great - this is the only pizza place in the area that doesn't give me heartburn.
Best NY style pizza in Saint Louis. Great for a lazy night with a movie.

I was born and raised in Jersey and I was lucky enough to grow up on Jersey pizza (Jersey and New York's pizza is very, very similar). I've gone to many east-coast style pizzas around stl and this is the BEST and most similar to my Jersey pizzas. Tastes great and great service. Five stars.
The pizza we had was the best yet, around Barnes-Jewish Hospital,  if your at Parkview Hotel,  you can walk there, you'll be glad you did.
Love it!

Went to this location on a recent visit to St. Louis. I had a great experience the pizza was delicious and the customer service was awesome the GM came out to our table and talked about the world cup with us and also interacted with my children he and his staff were very friendly and understanding of my children's restlessness and playfulness even when my daughter spilled soda all over the bathroom they were very quick to clean up the mess and ask if we needed anything else. We are going back to St Louis at the end of July and we will be eating here again
Ny style pizza here in st.Louis i know i am from newyork
The best NY Style pizza in St Louis. I know, I'm from NY.
Take out takes twice as long as promised. Place custom cold to comfortably dine in. Pizza is good.
Pretty good pizza, closest thing to new york pizza you can get in st.louis. I've read other reviews about customer service issues but I've been here 3 times and the staff has been so far amicable.

Too bad really, I love racanelli's pizza. The customer service at this location is a joke. One time i've delt with a competent person, he must not work often. Just hung up with a young lady who was having a conversation with a pal about how 'that girl looks in that picture' while taking my order (?? who does that?), then hung up on me. After trying to call back and inform the manager of the rude staff, I was told the Manager on Duty was too busy to take a call. The best part is when I insisted, the person who answered put me on hold, then turned around and picked up the phone acting like the Manager, I asked why he said the manager was busy if he was in fact the manager, and he responded with "i just had things to do"... I suppose Racanelli's staff thinks their customers are idiots. If you can deal with this type of customer service you might get a good slice of pizza. Not worth it to me.
Best pizza in the St Louis area!!!  Yes I'm from the East Coast and feel St Louis style pizza is nasty.  No processed Provel cheese here.  Only real cheese!
Good pizza for a good price.

Basic pepperoni pizza was definitely greasier than the chain stores, roughly as greasy as Sbarro's. That aside, the flavor was decent, and the authentic hand tossed crust was nice - has a brick oven taste almost. More expensive than a comparable pizza from the chain stores. Not great pizza, but good. Don't let it get cold, though...  I did enjoy the garlic knots - very flavorful, but for the price I expected more.  Place was clean, though as another person mentioned, empty. Strange for a beautiful Saturday afternoon.  I would go back, but there is definitely better out there.
